value:
Myrrh told me the darkness had
to be stopped—but it was already
too late for His Majesty...

We generals were meant to protect
our people, not assail our neighbors.
Our power exists to serve the weak.

It's said the Sacred Stones drove the
darkness back long ago. Yet we were
ordered to destroy them...

Ahh... Plenty of warm water, pristine
bathing tubs... Oohh, I could certainly
get used to the luxury on offer here.$k$p...Oh! How long have you been there?

I got a fine barrel, and I aim to
ferment some local vegetables
to mimic the flavors of home.

I am Selena. I bear a message
from $Nf.

Ever since His Majesty bestowed the
gift of the title Fluorspar on me, I've
given everything I have as his general.

I will not senselessly take another's
life, and I will lay no hand on any
who lack the power to resist!

I am a general of the Grado Empire
and servant to Emperor Vigarde.
I am Selena, Fluorspar.

I am grateful, but this is more than
I deserve. I hope to live up to your
expectations of me.

Urgh... Wh-where— Who... Right.
I am Selena of the Imperial Three.
Selena, Fluorspar.

Your Majesty, I— Oh. Please forgive
me, $Nu.$k$pI am grateful for your guidance.$k$pEven so, I still remain unable
to understand my true purpose
in this world.$k$pWhat I do know is that you have
a kind heart, and in that you remind
me of Emperor Vigarde.$k$pIn a way, that kindness alone can
be dangerous, if it can be twisted
and taken advantage of.$k$pBut I believe that is a lesson you've
well learned, or you would not have
made it to where you stand now.$k$pSo I will fight by your side to help
bring about the world you envision,
for I know it, too, will be a kind one.
はっ
甘い！
くっ…
ふがいない…
Settle this with steel!
I am Fluorspar!
I have no regrets!
In His Majesty's name!
So very tired...
ふ…
I am the Grado empire's servant and His Majesty's vassal. Call me General Selena, the Fluorspar.
You have a peculiar way of fraternizing, you know that?
On my emperor's command, I will fight without hesitation—even against my allies.
The role of an imperial general is that of the shield, not the blade.
I was but a commoner raised in poverty. Our village stopped paying taxes one winter, but the emperor sent provisions anyway. He saved my village—saved me.
My path may be considered foolish, I know. Yet it is my duty as a knight...
Ah. You resemble His Majesty in many ways. He was...so benevolent.
Affirmative.
Are you certain?
Orders acknowledged.
